page.title: 09HARLOW'S ECOLOGY
page.content: Our area is an urban enviroment and whilst there is a fair bit of industry mostly space is taken up by houses.One group went pond dipping near the museum and came back with 25 different specimens.There is a good range of bird life.After playtime we counted 32 seagulls in the infant playground eating the dropped bits of crisps. We had some ducks in class 1 and after six weeks let them go at the museum. Sadly two men were seen killing them. We felt bad so probably the biggest threat to animal life in our area is man.Still alot of effort is made to protect animal life.The nature reserve at Parndon Wood contains a lot of wild life like rabbits,deer,foxes and owls.
